topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Beta: Viewing Storage Profiles

body.p: A storage profile is a named configuration for a list of storage resources on a computing node
Note: This feature applies only to servers in regionone.

To view hardware profles:
Launch the HPE Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Inventory tab.
Click the Storage Profiles tables.
Each storage resource consists of the following elements:
Disks A Linux block storage device, such as /dev/sdd, identifying an entire hard drive.

Storage Volumes A storage volume consisting of a name and a storage function. The name is used as a human-readable version of the native storage device UUID. The storage function indicates the type of storage backend, such as OSD for a storage system.
For more information on how to create storage profiles, see Working with Storage Profiles.
